Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tax hikes by stating that they were passed under Obamacare, when in fact they were part of the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012.
Understate: The claim understates the bipartisan nature of the tax hikes by stating that no Republicans voted for them, when in fact they were part of a bipartisan deal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support for its assertion that all the tax hikes were passed only with Democrat votes, as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that if you have money, the Democrats want it, without providing any evidence or reasoning to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the tax hikes were part of a bipartisan effort to address the fiscal cliff and avoid mandated federal spending cuts.
